resources.string: It is safe to turn off or minimize this channel
This service doesn\'t use any resources but required for keeping the push notifier service alive. It is safe to minimize or turn off this notification channel from the "Notification Settings".

Automation apps like this are subject to battery optimization rules imposed by the device makers and the Android itself.\n\nYour system will most probably interrupt this notifier service, even though, it just waits for battery events without using any resources.
Slider for adjusting the battery level
Visit this link from the other device
On the Receiver ‚ÄúEnable Notification‚Äù and scan or paste the Code into this device.\n\nIf pairing is successful, you‚Äôll receive a confirmation notification on that device.
Tap & Hold for a moment to Unpair
Pairing Code is invalid. Make sure it is correctly scanned or copied.
Can\'t open Camera. Copy the Code and "Paste instead".
You need to provide the camera permission from Settings
Failed to connect to the receiver.\nCheck if your internet is working.\nThen check if the Pairing Code is scanned or pasted correctly.
System will pause this service whenever your device is unused for some time. You won\'t get any push notifications during that time without this permission.

If you don\'t actively interact with this app for a few days, system will pause this service until you open this app again. As this is an automation app that requires no interaction, this permission must be given.
Some OEMs keep a whitelist of known apps that can resume their services after phone restart. Without that permission, this service won\'t be able to resume as expected.
Allowing these should be sufficient for consistent service. If it\'s not, please visit the Tutorial tab for more comprehensive device specific instructions.
Check the other device for confirmation notification
